summary: This is an FBI interview summary (302 form) of Alfredo Rodriguez, a former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez describes witnessing evidence of sexual abuse of minors at Epstein's residence, possessing a 'black book' with contact information for underage females, and his attempt to sell this information to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, FBI interviewee
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who was interviewed by the FBI. He admitted to possessing Epstein's 'black book' containing contact information for underage females and described witnessing evidence of sexual abuse at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Rodriguez worked for him as a house manager and described witnessing evidence of sexual contact with minor females at his residence.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Attorney whom Rodriguez attempted to sell Epstein's 'black book' and related papers to for $50,000.

connections.description: Rodriguez worked as a house manager for Epstein for approximately six months between 2004 and 2005.
Rodriguez attempted to sell Epstein's 'black book' and related papers to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.
Rodriguez witnessed evidence of sexual abuse of minors at Epstein's residence and was tasked with cleaning sex toys after minor females departed.

events.title: Rodriguez's Employment with Epstein
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez worked as a house manager for Jeffrey Epstein for approximately six months during this period.

events.title: FBI Interview of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was interviewed by the FBI at 7920 Glades Road, Boca Raton, Florida, after waiving his Miranda rights. He described evidence of abuse and his attempt to sell Epstein's 'black book'.

events.title: Rodriguez's Attempt to Sell 'Black Book'
events.description: In the months leading up to the FBI interview, Rodriguez attempted to sell a copy of Epstein's 'black book' and related papers containing contact information for underage females to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, possessed a copy of Epstein's 'black book' containing contact information for numerous individuals he claimed were underage females.
Rodriguez witnessed naked minor females sunbathing at Epstein's pool, images of naked minor females on Epstein's computer, and knew Epstein was having sexual contact with minor females at his house.
Rodriguez was occasionally tasked with cleaning sex toys after minor females had departed Epstein's residence.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the 'black book' and related papers to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, citing financial hardship after losing his job with Epstein.
Rodriguez admitted he did not previously report this information to the FBI or other law enforcement, despite knowing of the investigation, because he was scared of Epstein.
